DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate safety efficacy laser atherectomy balloon angioplasty compare balloon angioplasty alone treatment knee peripheral artery in-stent restenosis .
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Study Laser Balloon Angioplasty Versus Balloon Angioplasty Treat Peripheral In-stent Restenosis
DOC.criteria: PAD Rutherford class 14 Resting ABI < 0.9 abnormal exercise ABI < 0.9 History previous femoropopliteal nitinol stenting Angiographic significant restenosis ( > =50 % ) Target lesion length > =4 cm ; 3 cm outside stent either end Vessel diameter > =5 mm < =7 mm At least one widely patent tibial peroneal artery foot Patient pregnant breast feed Evidence acute limb ischemia Life expectancy < 12 month CVA within 60 day screen Myocardial infarction within 60 day procedure Known allergy contract medium Known contraindication aspirin , antiplatelet anticoagulation therapy Uncontrolled hypercoagulability Present suspect systemic infection target limb Serum creatinine > = 2.5 mg/dl unless dialysis dependent Previous treatment target vessel within 3 month study procedure Drug elute stent cover stent target lesion Ipsilateral and/or contralateral iliac stenosis > = 50 % DS successfully treat prior index procedure final residual stenosis < = 30 % document angiography Planned predict cardiovascular surgical interventional procedure prior completion 30day followup Identification lesion target stent treat leg > 50 % require preplanned predicted treatment within 30 day ( prior 6 month follow ) Tibial artery contain > 50 % Diameter Stenosis ( DS ) visual estimate popliteal Grade 4 5 stent fracture affect target stent proximal target stent , evidence stent protrusion lumen note angiography 2 orthogonal view .
